show.title: Querelle
show.headline: Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s last and most controversial film

event.title: <show-title>Querelle</show-title>
event.headline: Sex, drugs, and murder abound in Fassbinder’s luridly erotic maritime swan song
event.description:
It’s the end of 2024 and Queer Film Theory 101 is going out with bang! While we typically explore films that strictly feature queer subtext, we decided to close out the year with some hardcore overt bisexual cinema from dearly departed queer auteur Rainer Werner Fassbinder.

In his final film, QUERELLE, Fassbinder releases the hounds of desire and deviance on France! Belgian sailor George Querelle (Brad Davis) arrives in the port of Brest (I mean… come on) aboard the cargo ship Le Vengeur with an appetite for sex, crime, and murder. And then he does those things. That’s the plot. Films aren’t always super complicated. Fassbinder’s subversive and grimy adaptation of Jean Genet’s equally controversial novel Querelle of Brest toes the line between exploitation and arthouse with a smattering of Tom of Finland and pulp thrown in the mix, and we love every filthy minute of it. This underseen queer erotic classic has never looked better after a recent digital restoration approved by the director of photography Xaver Schwarzenberger and we can’t wait to experience all of the debaucheries on the big screen with you. Batten down the hatches sailor, there’s a big bisexual storm a-brewin’.

show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A cheerful celebration with themed games, props & singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: Cries and Whispers
show.headline: Liv Ullmann shines in Ingmar Bergman's existential drama.

event.title: <show-title>Cries and Whispers</show-title>
event.headline: Robert Eggers personally recommends Ingmar Bergman's existential drama
event.description:
Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

CRIES AND WHISPERS is presented here as part of our Robert Eggers Guest Selects for influencing his new film, NOSFERATU. “CRIES AND WHISPERS by Ingmar Bergman is perhaps my favorite Bergman film. It’s also, you know, one of the best horror films ever made, even though it certainly doesn’t try to be one and wouldn’t be classified as one.” – Robert Eggers.

This existential wail of a drama from Ingmar Bergman concerns two sisters, Karin (Ingrid Thulin) and Maria (Liv Ullmann), keeping vigil for a third, Agnes (Harriet Andersson), who is dying of cancer and can find solace only in the arms of a beatific servant (Kari Sylwan). An intensely felt film that is one of Bergman’s most striking formal experiments, CRIES AND WHISPERS (which won an Oscar for the extraordinary color photography of Sven Nykvist) is a powerful depiction of human behavior in the face of death, positioned on the borders between reality and nightmare, tranquillity and terror. (Janus Films)

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

CRIES AND WHISPERS is presented here as part of our Robert Eggers Guest Selects for influencing his new film, NOSFERATU. “CRIES AND WHISPERS by Ingmar Bergman is perhaps my favorite Bergman film. It’s also, you know, one of the best horror films ever made, even though it certainly doesn’t try to be one and wouldn’t be classified as one.” – Robert Eggers.

show.title: Hot Rod
show.headline: Smack destiny in the face

event.title: <show-title>Hot Rod</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Our most stunt-y, daredevil-y movie party ever
event.description:
Who wants to see us throw a big-ass movie party?!

If that sounds like cool beans to you, then join us for HOT ROD, the supremely goofy cult classic about a small-town stuntman from the guys of The Lonely Island.

We think it’s absurdist perfection, so put on your most patriotic jumpsuit and strap in for a movie party for all you daredevils out there. We’ll have custom bandanas, fake mustaches (all great men have them), and even different spirit animals so you can choose the one that best represents you while you live your dream of feeling like a stuntperson without having to actually do any, you know, stunts.

So if you like to party, join us for a daring, action-packed movie party celebrating one of the most underrated comedies ever made.

show.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
show.headline: Doink de doink!

event.title: <show-title>Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Let us see that donkey roll
event.description:
With a hilarious lead performance from Andy Samberg, tons of killer cameos including Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, Usher, and Adam Levine’s hologram (so expensive!), and plenty of big laughs & bumpin’ tunez, POPSTAR has established itself as a modern cult classic.

That’s why we’re inviting you to kick it with the boyz of The Lonely Island at the most baller Movie Party of all time (#sohumble). We’ll have onscreen lyrics so you can get in on the jamz, some extremely humble sunglasses, “gold” necklaces to show you’re a ride-or-die Connor4Real fan, a tattoo honoring the greatest turtle to ever live, and a Party Wolves business card (DO NOT pay for them to come to this event). And be sure to show up early for our Show Pony drawing contest before the film.

So bring your crew, show us your Donkey Roll, and never stop never stopping at our POPSTAR Movie Party. DOINK DE DOINK!

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
With a hilarious lead performance from Andy Samberg, tons of killer cameos including Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, Usher, and Adam Levine’s hologram (so expensive!), and plenty of big laughs & bumpin’ tunez, POPSTAR has established itself as a modern cult classic.

That’s why we’re inviting you to kick it with the boyz of The Lonely Island at the most baller Sing-Along Movie Party of all time (#sohumble). We’ll have onscreen lyrics so you can get in on the jamz, some extremely humble sunglasses, “gold” necklaces to show you’re a ride-or-die Connor4Real fan, a tattoo honoring the greatest turtle to ever live, and a Party Wolves business card (DO NOT pay for them to come to this event). And be sure to show up early for our Show Pony drawing contest before the film.

So bring your crew, show us your Donkey Roll, and never stop never stopping at our POPSTAR Sing-Along Movie Party. You’ll be belting out all of Conner4Real’s greatest hits so loudly, it’ll be like you just opened your Aquaspin refrigerator. DOINK DE DOINK!

event.title: <show-title>Nosferatu (2024)</show-title> <event-type-title>Beyond the Grave Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate Count Orlok's arrival with a limited-edition merch bundle
event.description: Count Orlok didn’t just bring fear and over 5,000 real rats on his move to the big city, he also brought some highly exclusive merch – one of which is a rat, admittedly. Join us in welcoming our new dark overlord at our Beyond the Grave screening of NOSFERATU and you’ll get our exclusive sarcophagus popcorn bucket stuffed with a plush rat and a surprise keepsake. Sure, there’s a decent chance of becoming a mindless thrall of the vampyre, but that’s a small price to pay for such a rare treasure.

show.title: Terrifier 3
show.headline: Art the Clown is the real nightmare before Christmas

event.title: <show-title>Terrifier 3</show-title> <event-type-title>Christmas Event</event-type-title>
event.headline: Have yourself a Terrifier Christmas
event.description:
Celebrate the holidays with a Terrifier twist! Featuring a special intro from director Damien Leone and an exclusive sneak peek at the upcoming Terrifier documentary, ART ATTACK, be sure to have yourself a Terrifier Christmas.

After surviving Art the Clown’s Halloween massacre, Sienna and her brother are struggling to rebuild their shattered lives. As the holiday season approaches, they embrace the Christmas spirit and leave the horrors of the past behind. But just when they think they’re safe, Art the Clown returns, determined to turn their holiday cheer into a new nightmare.

show.title: Persona (1966)
show.headline: Ingmar Bergman's most personal and original film

event.title: <show-title>Persona (1966)</show-title>
event.headline: Almodóvar & Swinton personally recommend Ingmar Bergman's dreamlike visual poem
event.description:
Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

PERSONA is presented here as part of our Pedro Almodóvar/Tilda Swinton/Julianne Moore Guest Selects for influencing their new film, THE ROOM NEXT DOOR. “This sense of two women being in such a liaison that they kind of become, if not one, they become a sort of melange of two souls was really what we wanted to look at and PERSONA is the masterpiece in this regard.” – Tilda Swinton.

By the mid-'60s, Ingmar Bergman had already conjured many of the cinema’s most unforgettable images. But with the radical PERSONA, this supreme artist attained new levels of visual poetry. In the first of a series of legendary performances for Bergman, Liv Ullmann plays a stage actor who has inexplicably gone mute; an equally mesmerizing Bibi Andersson is the garrulous young nurse caring for her in a remote island cottage. While isolated together there, the women perform a mysterious spiritual and emotional transference that would prove to be one of cinema’s most influential creations. Acted with astonishing nuance and shot in stark contrast and soft light by the great Sven Nykvist, PERSONA is a penetrating, dreamlike work of profound psychological depth. (Janus)

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

show.title: Death Becomes Her
show.headline: Keep young and beautiful – or die trying!

event.title: <show-title>Death Becomes Her</show-title>
event.headline: Goldie Hawn & Meryl Streep slay the screen in this 1992 fatal femme cult classic
event.description:
“Now, a warning…”

What would you do to stay young forever? This is an evergreen question in many cinematic and literary explorations, from Oscar Wilde to the copious vampire narratives we consume, from THE SUBSTANCE to Korean skincare TikToks hocking the perfect recipe for “glass skin,” we are a species obsessed with delaying time's inevitable progression. Robert Zemeckis’ 1992 black comedy (co-written by Journeymen screenwriter David Koepp and Martin Donovan) DEATH BECOMES HER is a classic example of this trope played out in gloriously campy fashion. Goldie Hawn and Meryl Streep are Helen Sharp and Madeline Ashton, two frenemies who compete in all things, especially for the attention and affection of dopey plastic surgeon Ernest Menville (played against type by a delightful Bruce Willis). When presented with a method of reversing and halting their aging by the gorgeous and mysterious vamp Lisle Von Rhuman (THE ICON Isabella Rosellini) both women seize the clandestine opportunity, and from there, things get grim and zany. Overflowing with subtextual sapphic angst and seething with a deep investment in the emasculation of cis straight men, this movie is a freaking blast! Groundbreaking Acadamy Award-winning special effects and hilarious performances from its entire cast helped launch DEATH BECOMES HER to cult classic status (especially amongst queer audiences) despite mixed reviews from critics. As Madeline would say, “Screw the critics” – this movie is a STAR! Help us kick off the 2025 season of Queer Film Theory 101 with a dose of the potion with the motion. Stay beautiful, queerdos (but then again, you always are.)

show.title: Disembodied
show.headline: 4K restoration of the body horror acid trip

event.title: <show-title>Disembodied</show-title>
event.headline: 4K restoration of the body horror acid trip
event.description:
Indebted to David Lynch's ERASERHEAD, Ed Wood's PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE, and Frank Henenlotter's BRAIN DAMAGE, DISEMBODIED is a cinematic acid trip that blurs the line between horror and experimental art. The story follows Connie Sproutz, a gothed-out scientist who checks into the decrepit Grand Hotel to continue her experiments...and turn people into slime before eating them. Shot in Reno by director Willam Kersten on gritty 16mm film, this DIY passion project is filled with stop-motion effects, gory body horror, and surrealist visuals. Bleeding Skull is honored to present a 4K restoration of the original, uncut version of DISEMBODIED for the first time ever.

4K restoration courtesy of Bleeding Skull

show.title: Green Room
show.headline: Jeremy Saulnier's Punks vs. Nazis survivalist thriller.

event.title: <show-title>Green Room</show-title>
event.headline: Jeremy Saulnier's Punks vs. Nazis survivalist thriller.
event.description:
Down on their luck punk rockers The Ain’t Rights (Anton Yelchin, Imogene Poots, Alia Shawkat) are finishing up a long and unsuccessful tour, and are about to call it quits when they get an unexpected booking at an isolated, run-down club deep in the backwoods of Oregon. What seems merely to be a third-rate gig escalates into something much more sinister when they witness an act of violence backstage that they weren’t meant to see. Now trapped backstage, they must face off against the club’s depraved owner, Darcy Banker (Patrick Stewart), a man who will do anything to protect the secrets of his nefarious enterprise. But while Darcy and his henchmen think the band will be easy to get rid of, The Ain’t Rights prove themselves much more cunning and capable than anyone expected, turning the tables on their unsuspecting captors and setting the stage for the ultimate life-or-death showdown. (A24)

DCP courtesy of A24

show.title: Jaws: The Revenge
show.headline: A Great White in the Bahamas is an easy way to ruin Christmas.

event.title: <show-title>Jaws: The Revenge</show-title>
event.headline: A Great White in the Bahamas is an easy way to ruin Christmas.
event.description:
After a recent Great White attack claims the life of her youngest son at Christmas, a recently-widowed Ellen Brody jets down the Bahamas where her other son, now a marine biologist, is on the verge of a scientific breakthrough. Great timing, as the same shark from New England has now emerged in the Caribbean to enact its own set of vengeance.

The beauty of JAWS: THE REVENGE lies in its absurdity and dream logic - a sequel to one of the most successful and satisfying pop delights of all-time now feels like its own Italian knock-off. Where else can one witness a woman of a certain age try to get her groove back with Michael Caine while locking into a psychic battle with a shark holding a vendetta against her entire family? That's a Christmas gift that we all deserve. (Jake Isgar)

4k DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures.

show.title: Dinner in America
show.headline: A DIY love letter to being yourself and being punk AF

event.title: <show-title>Dinner in America</show-title>
event.headline: A DIY love letter to being yourself and being punk AF
event.description:
In a dreary Midwestern suburb, aggro punk rocker Simon (Kyle Gallner, JENNIFER'S BODY) finds himself on the run again after a bout of arson and a close call with the police. A chance encounter with the spirited and socially awkward Patty (Emily Skeggs, THE MISEDUCATION OF CAMERON POST) provides him a place to lay low. As the two embark on a series of misadventures, they begin to realize they have a lot more in common than they first expected… (Arrow Films)

DCP courtesy of Monument Releasing

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Drop Dead Fred
show.headline: What if your imaginary friend came back?

event.title: <show-title>Drop Dead Fred</show-title>
event.headline: What if your imaginary friend came back?
event.description:
Much beloved by those who grew up in the early ’90s, DROP DEAD FRED is about a young woman (Phoebe Cates, GREMLINS) whose mental health takes a nosedive after her husband runs off with a young blonde. Kids love marital problems! Throw in some blue language and sexual situations, and it's a wonder any parent let their child view this odd BEETLEJUICE riff.

Rik Mayall (The Young Ones) is the titular DROP DEAD FRED. With a face as elastic as Jim Carrey and a unique screamy delivery, he bulldozes through every scene, chewing it up and spitting it out. Cates gives an empathetic performance as the victim of an overbearing mother, a philandering husband, and the world's most obnoxious imaginary friend.

Sure, critics may not have loved it, but kids of the ’90s liked their entertainment weird and wacky, and DROP DEAD FRED’s gross-out hijinks (paired with valuable life lessons, of course) fit the bill. Maybe that’s why we’re still watching it all these years later.

show.title: Intrépidos Punks
show.headline: A sublime piece of '80s punksploitation, newly restored

event.title: <show-title>Intrépidos Punks</show-title>
event.headline: A sublime piece of '80s punksploitation, newly restored
event.description:
Presented in Spanish with English subtitles

MAD MAX through the lens of Mexican genre cinema, INTRÉPIDOS PUNKS is a biker exploitation film with DIY grit and anarchic attitude to burn. Violent gang leader Tarzan has just broken loose from prison, and he and his punk compatriots are ready to wreak havoc in all the ways they know best: impersonating nuns to rob banks, having wild orgies, and murdering anyone looking to keep them from a good time. With its potent grindhouse atmosphere and live musical performances from the gang itself, grungy lo-fi excellence flows freely in the veins of this Mexican exploitation classic.

DCP courtesy of Vinegar Syndrome and the American Genre Film Archive

event.headline: ...and a wonderful brunch! Join us for this perennial holiday classic.
event.description: Order from our tasty brunch menu – Breakfast Club, Blueberry Donut French Toast Bake, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Coming Up Rosé Fizz. Each is available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

show.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 3
show.headline: Dash into theaters for Sonic, stay for Keanu as Shadow

event.title: <show-title>Sonic the Hedgehog 3</show-title> <event-type-title>Family Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Bring your team to see the Sonic team
event.description: Power up your SONIC 3 experience with our interactive movie party for your whole Sonic Team. Your ticket includes a blue Sonic quill glowstick, a bag of Sonic rings and chaos emeralds, and a keychain featuring Sonic’s iconic red shoes. Plus, choose whether you want to be Sonic or Shadow with a Hedgehog Headband, or take part in our Dr. Robotnik mustache-making craft. Hurry, because tickets to our SONIC THE HEDGEHOG 3 Family Party are going fast.

show.title: Space Is the Place
show.headline: Delivers Bay Area afro-futurism in the '70s.

posterImages.altText: Space is the place lobby poster

event.title: <show-title>Space Is the Place</show-title>
event.headline: Sun Ra delivers a dose of afro-futurist acid jazz in this 4K Restoration.
event.description:
Screening as a part of WEIRD SF - a monthly celebration of Bay Area oddities co-presented by Amoeba Music, with pre-screening DJ set in Bear vs. Bull.

Spurring from his frequent lectures in the late '60s at UC-Berkeley, Sun Ra hits the big screen with a touch of the power cosmic in SPACE IS THE PLACE.

Sun Ra and his Arkestra return to Earth after several years in space. Ra proclaims himself “the alter-destiny”, meets with inner-city youths and battles with the devil himself to save his fellow man in this afro-futurist dose of acid jazz that plays like a mix between THE DAY THE EARTH STOOD STILL, THE SEVENTH SEAL, and DOLEMITE. (Jake Isgar)

show.headline: See A24's steamy thriller opening weekend & pick up a free souvenir recipe card

event.title: <event-type-title>Advance Screening:</event-type-title> <show-title>Babygirl</show-title>
event.headline: See Nicole Kidman's steamy new thriller before anyone else
event.description: Do you like to be told what to do? Then see BABYGIRL before anyone else at our Advance Screening. If you’ve been especially good, we’ve got some rewards in store, including a specially crafted BABYGIRL cocktail and a letterpress printed recipe card. Do as you’re told – see the season’s steamiest new thriller early.

show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

And this party is a real beaut, with yuletide props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glow sticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? show.title: Basket Case 2
show.headline: We're gonna need a bigger basket!

event.title: <show-title>Basket Case 2</show-title>
event.headline: Another good display of bad taste from Frank Henenlotter.
event.description:
Frank Henenlotter is a national treasure. If you weren’t convinced of that fact after watching BASKET CASE, FRANKENHOOKER, or BRAIN DAMAGE, the joyful perversion of BASKET CASE 2 will make you a believer. Immediately after the events of BASKET CASE, Duane and his heinously malformed brother Belial are “rescued” by a sweet old lady named Ruth. But the secrets in Ruth’s attic might be more than the brothers can handle. BASKET CASE 2 defies expectations to stand tall as a beautiful melding of John Waters’ POLYESTER, H.G. Lewis’ THE GRUESOME TWOSOME, and Tod Browning’s FREAKS. In other words, director Henenlotter delivers everything you could possibly want out of a sequel to a movie about a deformed monster who lives in a wicker basket and eats people’s faces for breakfast. (AGFA)

DCP courtesy of Troma Films and the American Genre Film Archive.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
